**Sine:**\
$$\begin{aligned}
\sin(2a)&=&\sin(a+a)\\
&=&\sin(a)\cos(a)+\cos(a)\sin(a)\\
&=&2\sin(a)\cos(a).\end{aligned}$$

**Cosine:** $$\begin{aligned}
\cos(2a)&=&\cos(a+a)\\
&=&\cos(a)\cos(a)+\sin(a)\sin(a)\\
&=&\cos^2(a)-\sin^2(a).\end{aligned}$$

By using the identity $$\sin^2(a)+\cos^2(a)=1$$ we can change the
expression above into the alternate forms
$$\cos(2a)=2\cos^2(a)-1 = 1-2\sin^2(a).$$

**Tangent:** $$\begin{aligned}
\tan(2a)&=&\tan(a+a)\\
&=&\frac{\tan(a)+\tan(a)}{1-\tan(a)\tan(a)}\\
&=&\frac{2\tan(a)}{1-\tan^2(a)}.\end{aligned}$$
